title: turretless_tank
body:
A [[tank]] or tank-like armored [[military vehicle]] featuring a casemate (turretless) design, with the main gun mounted directly within the hull of the vehicle instead of in a rotating turret.

Advantages of such designs were that they were mechanically simpler than turreted designs, less costly to produce, lighter in weight, and lower in profile. Due to taking up less weight in the design, heavier armor and/or armaments could be added onto the chassis.  A primary disadvantage to this design was that the main weapon was affixed with a limited fire arc in the front and thus required the entire vehicle rotating to be able to target things outside this arc.

h4. Examples

* !post #1475708: [[Jagdpanther]]

h4. List of Real Life Vehicles

h6. WWII - German

* [[Jagdpanther]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Jagdpanzer 38(t)|Jagdpanzer 38(t) - "Hetzer"]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Jagdtiger]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmgeschutz III]] (Assault Gun/Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmgeschutz IV]] (Assault Gun/Tank Destroyer)
* [[Sturmtiger]] (Assault Gun)

h6. WWII - Russian

* [[SU-85]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[SU-100]] (Tank Destroyer)
* [[ISU-122]] (Assault Gun/Self-Propelled Gun/Tank Destroyer)
* [[ISU-152]] (Assault Gun/Self-Propelled Gun/Tank Destroyer)

h6. Post-WWII - Swedish

* [[Strv 103]] / "S-Tank" (Main Battle Tank)

h4. See also

* [[assault gun]]
* [[self-propelled artillery]]
* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]

h4. External links

* "Wikiipedia: Casemate (Armored vehicles)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Casemate#Armoured_vehicles

title: strv_103
body: Also known as the S-Tank, the Stridsvagn 103 is a Swedish turretless main battle tank. While it lacks a turret, its extremely sloped hull armor and hydropneumatic suspension enable it to fire its powerful 105mm gun safely from behind hill crests and greatly reduce weight.

title: bachi
body:
A [[plectrum]] (pick) used for stringed instruments like the [[shamisen]] and [[biwa lute|biwa]].

It should not be confused with the straight, wooden [[taiko sticks]] used to play Japanese [[taiko drum]]s, which are also called bachi (written 桴, 枹).

title: kirze
body:
Playable character from [[King's Raid]]. A hybrid animal girl born with unique mana. During her early years, she was captured by the Dark Legion and became a guinea pig for body crystallization experiments. After escaping with her newfound power, she shatters her enemies with crimson crystals that form her body.

Uniquely, Kirze is a fan-designed character that was implemented into the game as the result of winning a character design contest.

title: floating_hair
body:
Hair that is blowing in the [[wind]], floating in midair, or otherwise not being held down by gravity.

Generally does not apply to [[tail]]s or hair that is messy or styled to appear gravity-defying.

Not to be confused with [[hair flowing over]], which is hair draped over a surface, or [[hair spread out]], which is hair spread over a surface, or  [[detached hair]], which is hair magically disconnected from the head.

title: simple_background
body:
An image with an empty or featureless background.

As a rule of thumb, such pictures can be easily extracted from the background, and placed on other backgrounds.

A fully [[transparent background]] also counts for simple. 

h4. See also

* [[white background]]
* [[negative space]]
* [[Tag group:Backgrounds]]

title: line_(naver)
body:
A messenger [[smartphone]] application originally developed by NHN Japan, a Japanese branch of South Korean internet company [[Naver (website)|]]. Widely used in East Asian and South East Asian countries. 

It has the "[[sticker (medium)|stickers]]" feature where people can buy sets of emote images, many of which are of popular anime, manga, video games, etc. Users can also make their own stickers. The application is very popular for making chatrooms for smartphone games with guild-like features in order to communicate and work together.

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://www.line.me/en/]
* "Wikipedia: Line (software)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_(software)]

title: bastard!!
body:
[b]Bastard‼: Heavy Metal, Dark Fantasy[/b] (BASTARD!!-暗黒の破壊神- Basutādo!! Ankoku no Hakaishin?, lit. "Bastard!! The Destructive God of Darkness") is a manga by Kazushi Hagiwara. It first appeared in [[weekly_shounen_jump|Weekly Shōnen Jump]], in 1988, and continues to be published irregularly today in Ultra Jump. Currently, it spans 27 volumes.

There are two animated adaptations; a 6 episode OVA by AIC released in 1992, as well as a 39 episode series by Liden Films in 2022-2023.

h4. External links

* "Official Anime Site":https://bastard-anime.com/
* "Official X":https://x.com/bastard_PR

title: oxenfree
body: Oxenfree is a graphic adventure game developed and published by Night School Studio. It was released for OS X, Windows, and Xbox One in January 2016. In Oxenfree, players assume the role of the teenage girl Alex on a weekend trip to a local island. After seemingly supernatural events occur, Alex and her friends must unravel the secrets of the island

title: taut_clothes
body:
Clothing that is so tight that the fabric ripples, usually between the [[breasts]].

Not to be confused with [[tight clothes]] or [[impossible clothes]]. Tight clothes are clothes that are very tight, but not [[skin tight]]. Impossible clothes are clothes that unrealistically conform to the shape of the body, especially around the breasts. Taut clothes refers specifically to the fabric rippling effect.

title: apple_(reverse:1999)
body:
APPLe is an Arcanist in [[Reverse:1999]]

A sentient apple, partner of [[Regulus (Reverse:1999)|Regulus]] and came from the same era as her. He acts as the reasonable mind to Regulus' free and sometimes chaotic personality. He has a masculine voice and calls himself "This Apple". APPLe is also the mascot of Pirate Radio DJ, a rock radio station hosted by Regulus.

APPLe is voiced by Elliot Hardman in English and [[Hirakawa Daisuke]] in Japanese.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6815248: Default
* !post #6815250: Insight II: Erudite and Juicy
* !post #6839227: Echoing to Woodstock
* !post #9852888: [[apple (the fruit of wisdom) (reverse:1999)|The Fruit of Wisdom]]

title: new_orleans_pelicans
body:
The New Orleans Pelicans (Français: Pelicans de La Nouvelle-Orléans) are a professional [[basketball]] team based in [[New Orleans]], [[Louisiana]], the [[United States]]. The team was founded in 2002 as the New Orleans Hornets before spending two seasons as the New Orleans/Oklahoma City Hornets. The team would fully return to New Orleans from 2007-2012 before being renamed to the Pelicans in 2013.

The team competes as a member of the Southwest Division in the Western Conference. The team colors are blue, gold and red.

title: touhou_danmaku_kagura
body:
[[Touhou]] mobile rhythm game developed by AQUA STYLE and published by DeNA & Xeen, under the collective title 'Unknown X'. The original mobile game was released on August 4, 2021 and ended service on October 28, 2022. The day the service ended, a standalone re-built version of Danmaku Kagura was announced for Steam, titled 'Touhou Danmaku Kagura: Phantasia Lost', alongside a crowdfunding effort. It was released on February 8, 2024.

h4. External links

* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/danmakuJP
other_names: 東方ダンマクカグラファンタジア・ロスト

title: border
body:
When a picture has a border along its sides. Most often, this is a simple solid color border on all four sides. See [[ornate border]] for more complex borders.

See [[outside border]] for when a character is drawn above the image's border.

Note that [[letterboxed]] and [[pillarboxed]] do not count as borders. However [[outside border]] may be used with them.

h4. Related tags

h6.Colors

* [[aqua border]]
* [[black border]]

title: censored
body:
When parts of the image (typically graphic or sensitive contents such as sexual organs, gore, or offensive symbolism) are obscured, typically to comply with censorship laws.

On Danbooru, this typically encompasses various Japanese pornographic materials that were censored as a result of the Japanese law. Techniques that prevent viewing sexual parts, usually [[pussy|vaginas]], [[penis]]es and [[dildo]]s but occasionally [[nipples]]. Note that the [[anus]] is not usually considered a sexual part in Japanese censorship.  

Common forms include [[mosaic censoring|mosaics]], [[bar censor|black bars]], [[blur censor|blurs]], mysterious [[light censor|white lights]], inverted colors, shaded bars, and the infamous [[invisible penis]]. [[Tentacles]] or phallic objects are commonly used to resemble genitals and generally don't need to be censored, though the point of intercourse with a vagina does. 

For obstructions that are [i]internal[/i] to the picture, like a lock of [[hair_censor|hair]] that just happens to cover the genitals, use the tag [[convenient censoring]] instead of censored.

h4. Types of censorship

* [[bar censor]]
* [[blank censor]]
* [[blur censor]]
* [[censored by text]]
* [[emoji censor]]
* [[flower censor]]
* [[glitch censor]]
* [[heart censor]]
* [[interface censor]]
* [[light censor]]
* [[mosaic censoring]]
* [[novelty censor]]
** [[character censor]]
** [[Patreon logo censor]]

h6. Non-sexual censorship

title: father_(fma)
body:
A man who resembles [[Van Hohenheim]].

[spoiler]He is the main antagonist of [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]. He was a homunculus created from the blood of Hohenheim. In this first form, he was a small black orb with a single eye, mouth, and little arms. He was called "Homunculus" by his creators, or "Dwarf in the flask" by Hohenheim due to being trapped in the flask that housed him.

Later, he took on Hohenheim's form and created the seven homunculus from his own body and had them call him "Father".[/spoiler]

title: kirby's_return_to_dream_land_deluxe
body:
The remake of [[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]], released on February 24th, 2023 for the [[Nintendo Switch]] as a late celebration of [i][[kirby_(series)|Kirby's]][/i] 30th anniversary. A digital Demo was released earlier that month, on February 8th.

h4. Notable additions
* Graphical overhaul.
* All playable characters can emote using the right control stick.
* Helper Magolor, an easier difficulty that grants extra items and helps against bottomless pits.
* Two new copy abilities: [[sand kirby|Sand]] and [[mecha kirby|Mecha]], and the return of [[festival kirby|Festival]].
* [[Merry Magoland]]: a new area run by [[Magolor]] with multiple mini-games from previous [i]Kirby[/i] games (plus two new ones), all playable with up to 4 players.
* [[magolor epilogue|Magolor Epilogue: The Interdimensional Traveler]], an all-new extra mode that features a playable Magolor after the main game's events.
* [[Kirby]]'s friends all gain extra moves first seen in [[Kirby Star Allies]].
* [spoiler] [[Magolor Soul]] becomes way more powerful in The True Arena [/spoiler]

h4. Other changes
* [[King Dedede]] receives a re-design, not unlike the one seen in [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]]
* [[Bandana Waddle Dee]] is now fully referred as such (in the original, it was only "[[Waddle Dee]]"), and the once red cloth at the tip of his spear is now yellow, as seen in other modern releases.
* Characters can wear Dress-Up Masks based on multiple characters from across the [[kirby (series)|series]].
* The Super Abilities used by Kirby are generally made faster.
* All bosses now have special Pause screen descriptions.
* Certain events in the game have different music. A few notable examples:
** The mid-boss tower in the fifth stage of Nutty Noon, if Kirby takes the secret entrance.
** [[HR-D3]]'s second phase using "Roar of Dedede" from [[Kirby and the Forgotten Land]].
** [spoiler] [[Magolor Soul]] using "Super Ruler's Coronation - OVERLORD" from [[Kirby Star Allies]] in The True Arena.[/spoiler]

h4. External links
* "Official website":https://kirbysreturntodreamlanddeluxe.nintendo.com/
* "Official website (UK)":https://www.nintendo.co.uk/Games/Nintendo-Switch-games/Kirby-s-Return-to-Dream-Land-Deluxe-2267334.html
* "Official website (JP)":https://www.nintendo.co.jp/switch/a2jya/index.html
* "WiKirby: Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Kirby%27s_Return_to_Dream_Land_Deluxe
other_names: 星のカービィWiiデラックス

title: magolor
body:
A character in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i]. Known as [b]Mahoroa[/b] in the Japanese release. He enlists the help of [[Kirby]] [[king_dedede|and]] [[meta_knight|his]] [[bandana_waddle_dee|friends]] to repair his spaceship, the [[Lor Starcutter]].

[spoiler]His true motives are hardly mentioned until the very end of the main story, where it is revealed that he really wanted to steal the [[Master Crown]] from its guardian, [[Landia]]. After he succeeds, he tries to conquer the universe, starting with [[Planet Popstar]]. Fortunately, Kirby and company are able to stop him.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After his defeat, he surprisingly tries to make amends with Kirby, and reveals he may have been used as a puppet by the Master Crown itself.[/spoiler] He starts by building an amusement park in [i][[kirby's dream collection special edition|Kirby's Dream Collection]][/i], and he continues to provide support for future adventures, including running a shop in [i][[Team Kirby Clash Deluxe]][/i], being a Dream Friend in [i][[kirby star allies|Kirby Star Allies]][/i], and building another amusement park, [[Merry Magoland]], in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]][/i].

h4. See Also
* [spoiler][[marx_(kirby)|Marx]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Hyness]][/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Void Termina]][/spoiler]
* [[Magolor Epilogue]]

title: gun_god
body: The last unaltered human on Earth in the short novel [[Angel_Notes|Notes]]. He is a sharpshooter who wields the conceptual weapon known as the [[Black Barrel (type-moon)|]].

title: barrel_replica_(type-moon)
body:
[[Sion Eltnam Atlasia]]'s main weapon of choice alongside [[etherlite]] in [[Melty Blood]].

This [b]Mystic Code[/b] is a replica of the [[Black Barrel (type-moon)|]], one of the seven superweapons on display at the Atlas Institute.

It is a Conceptual Weapon of "natural lifespan", which demonstrates a toxin (attack power) in proportion to the predestined span of the target's life. 

* "Type-Moon wikia":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Sion_Eltnam_Atlasia#Barrel_Replica

title: black_barrel_(type-moon)
body:
Black Barrel is one of the Seven Superweapons of Atlas, one of seven weapons developed and kept by Atlas of the Mage's Association.

The gun is a "Conceptual Weapon of natural life-span", capable of imposing the notion of limited life-span into the body of near-immortal creatures. Composed of True Ether, bullets fired from the gun will disintegrate all instances of Grain and Ether they come into contact with, ignoring any parameters of beings that intake either substance to deliver direct damage.

h4. Users

* [[Gun God]] 
* [[Mash Kyrielight]] 
* [[Habetrot (Fate)|]] 

h4. See also

* [[Barrel Replica (type-moon)|]] 

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon wikia":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Black_Barrel

title: ring_piercing
body:
A ring-shaped [[piercing]]. 

Use this if the piercing forms a closed loop of rigid material between both points of insertion into the skin.

title: nipple_rings
body:
It is a [[ring piercing]] placed in the [[nipples]] or a ring-shaped [[nipple piercing]]. Use this if the piercing forms a closed loop of rigid material between both points of insertion into the skin.  

If it is not a complete loop, or the loop is completed by non-rigid material such as chain, it should likely be tagged as [[nipple bar]] (and possibly [[nipple jewelry]]) instead. 

Sometimes depicted with something attached to it, such as [[nipple jewelry]], a [[nipple chain]], [[nipple weights]], or [[used condom]].

Do [i]not[/i] use when the rings are around the [[nipples|nipple]] and not embedded in it as a [[piercing]] would be. Use [[nipple sleeves]] in this case.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Piercings]]
* [[Tag Group:Breasts Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

title: david_mccallum
body: [b]David Keith McCallum Jr.[/b] (19 September 1933 – 25 September 2023) was a British-American actor and musician. He first gained recognition in the 1960s for playing secret agent [[Illya Kuryakin]] in the television series [[The Man from U.N.C.L.E.]]. His other notable television roles include [[Simon Carter]] in [[Colditz]] (1972–1974) and Steel in [[Sapphire & Steel]] (1979–1982). Beginning in 2003, McCallum gained renewed international popularity for his role as NCIS chief medical examiner [[donald_mallard|Dr. Donald "Ducky" Mallard]] in the CBS television series [[NCIS]], which he played for 20 seasons until his death in 2023. In film roles, McCallum notably appeared in [[The Great Escape]] (1963), and as [[Judas Iscariot]] in [[The Greatest Story Ever Told]] (1965).

title: the_naked_gun_(series)
body:
A comedy police parody movie trilogy created by Jim Abrahams and brothers David and Jerry Zucker and staring [[Leslie Nielsen]].

Originally began as a comedy tv series, [i]Police Squad![/i] which aired in 1982 before being cancelled after six episodes, the Naked Gun movies follow the misadventures of Detective [[Frank Drebin]] (Nielsen), a police detective for the [[Los Angeles Police Department|LAPD]] who has a good heart but a bumbling personality, who solves cases and fight bad guys. Other recurring characters in the series includes Jane Spencer (Priscilla Presley) Frank's love interest, Captain Ed Hocken (George Kennedy) Frank's boss, Ted Olson (Ed Williams) a scientist who designs Frank's gadgets and Detective Fred Nordberg, Frank's partner, who is played by O.J. Simpsons before his infamous arrest and acquittal in 1994-1995 for the murder of his ex-wife Nicole Brown and her friend Ron Goldman.

A new Naked Gun movie staring [[Liam Neeson]] as Frank Drebin Jr, was released in 2025.

h4. List of Naked Gun Films

* The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)
* [[The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear]] (1991)
* [[Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult]] (1993)
* The Naked Gun (2025)

title: yuiman_asama
body:
[b]The Key Weak Point of the Glorious Capital[/b]

Stage 4 Boss and Extra Stage Midboss of [[Fossilized Wonders]].

Yuiman is [[barefoot]],  has [[long_hair|long]], [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Surrounding her [[dress]] is a large [[sash]] resembling a [[snake]], which perpetually eats parts of her [[torn dress]] and rebirths it into human-shaped cloth. 

Yuiman was the princess from a country of Shinjin(God-humans) known as Yuimankoku, who was jointly worshipped in the same shrine as [[Iwanaga_ariya|Iwanaga]]. However, she was kidnapped and brainwashed by the Gods of Takamagahara(who would eventually build their Capital on The Moon and become The Lunarians) to labor for them by reconstructing/rendering impurity harmless from within Asama Joue(Impurity-Cleansing) Mountain to sustain the Lunar Capital. During the events of Fossilized Wonders, the overflow of impurity(=life information) produced by AI coming from the Outside World made Yuiman blow a fuse, which led her to be rebooted and her brainwashing to be undone by [[Watatsuki_no_Toyohime|Toyohime]].


Note: The Western order of her name is not "Asama Yuiman", as there is an interpunct in her name implying that both "Yuiman" and "Asama" are her name, similar to how it works for Reisen, and in-story, all of the characters refer to her as "Yuiman".

h4. Appearance

* !post #9811559

h4. External links

* "Touhou wiki: Yuiman Asama":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Yuiman_Asama

title: hijiri_byakuren
body:
"The Sealed Great Magician",  introduced as the final boss of [[Touhou]] [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A Buddhist magician whose younger brother [[Hijiri Myouren]]'s traumatic death drove her to seek agelessness, as well as a pacifist who believes in equality between humans and youkai. Once sealed in Makai by humans (where many think she made friends with and learned spellcards from [[Shinki (touhou)|]]), but was freed during Undefined Fantastic Object by her followers [[Toramaru Shou]], [[Murasa Minamitsu]] and [[Kumoi Ichirin]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[gradient hair]] that goes from [[purple hair|purple]] to [[brown hair|brown]] or [[blonde hair|blonde]] and usually [[yellow eyes]]. Some fans were confused if her hair was either gradient or if the purple was just from the lighting coming from her [[Sorcerer's Sutra Scroll|scroll]], but later games confirmed the gradient. Her main outfit is a [[layered dress]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]] [[cross-laced dress|cross-laced together]], and [[black boots]]. In [[Hopeless Masquerade]] she is depicted with an [[ajirogasa]] hat and a [[necklace]] of [[prayer beads]]. In [[Urban Legend in Limbo]] she gets a [[black bodysuit|black]] [[bikesuit]] and a [[green scarf]] along with her own [[motorcycle]], nicknamed [[Turbo Byakuren]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #2772756: Usual appearance [br] ([[Undefined Fantastic Object]])

title: sayla_mass
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] TV show from 1979. 

[b]Sayla Mass[/b] is a junior member of the [[Earth Federation]] [[White Base]] [[spacecraft]] crew. She is a [[Core Fighter]]/[[G-Fighter]]/[[Core Booster]] [[pilot]].

[spoilers]She is the actual sister of [[Char Aznable]]/[[Casval Rem Deikun]].[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]Also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]] (2025). In this continuity she is shown to have still joined the [[Earth Federation]], and pilots a [[Light Type Guncannon]] with the colors of the [[white gundam|original Gundam]].[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]In GQuuuuuux, her encounter and subsequent duel with [[Char Aznable]] (in the [[Red Gundam]]) during the fall of Solomon in Granada City on the Moon is implied to be the cause for the Zeknova Event that caused the disappearance of Char and the Red Gundam (as well as a big chunk of the Solomon asteroid).[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]Sayla Mass becomes the Princess/Queen of Zeon at the end of GQuuuuuux.[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [spoilers][[Artesia Som Deikun]][/spoilers]

title: hentai
body:
Danbooru uses a rating system for obscenity. See {{is:nsfw}}.

For more specific results, use:

* {{rating:questionable}} - Nudity or near-nudity, but no sex.
* {{rating:explicit}} - Sexually explicit.

Hentai (ヘンタイ or 変態) is a Japanese term meaning abnormal or [[pervert|perverted]]. In the west, it is used to refer to drawn and [[animated]] Japanese [[pornography]].

h4. See also

* [[howto:rate]]

title: crystal
body:
A crystal consists of matter that is formed from an ordered arrangement of atoms, molecules, or ions.  At the macroscopic scale crystals have well defined shapes with flat faces. Examples of crystals are [[snowflakes]], diamonds, and quartz.

For tagging purposes this tag is to be used for objects that are generally composed of translucent material and whose surface is composed of facets (flat surfaces).  

If it has been cut in an organized manner, particularly like that used for jewelry, then the [[diamond_(gemstone)]] tag should also be included.

If the object is rounded and features no edges between surfaces, then the object should be tagged [[gem]] instead.

For the Nuclear Throne character see [[crystal (nuclear throne)]].

h4. See also

* [[Crystal ball]]
* [[Crystal sword]]

title: death_korps_of_krieg
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. The Death Korps, sometimes called "Kriegers", hail from the irradiated death world of Krieg. Specialized in siege and trench warfare, they have garnered infamy for their obsession with sacrificing themselves for the sins of their rebellious ancestors and their impersonal, gas-masked appearance.

title: donuts_have_zero_calories_(meme)
body:
The "Zero Calories Theory" is a joke made by the [[manzai]] duo Sandwichman in 2017. Their straightman, [[Date Mikio]], proposed a revolutionary theory how not to get fat - some foods contain no calories depending on their ingredients or how they're prepared.

There's many Sandwichman's zero calories jokes, among them one especially liked is how [[donut|donuts]] contain no calories.
* Calories are concentrated in the center of food. Therefore, foods with a hole in the center, such as donuts or [[baumkuchen]], have 0 kcal because their central part was hollowed out.
* Foods shaped like a ring, such as donuts, represent the number "0" and actually contain 0 kcal.

The joke found its way into manga, anime & games, for example [[Cafe Stella To Shinigami No Chou]] and [[Blue Archive]]. Thanks to the Zero Calories Theory, Sandwichman won the "Ame Talk! Grand Prize" in 2018, and that same year, the theory was spread further through the song "Umarvelous":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XWo627F7CeU] by MONKEY MAJIK.

!post #7156704

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%B5%E3%83%B3%E3%83%89%E3%82%A6%E3%82%A3%E3%83%83%E3%83%81%E3%83%9E%E3%83%B3_(%E3%81%8A%E7%AC%91%E3%81%84%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3%E3%83%93)]

body: Avatar character of [[VIVINOS]], depicted as wearing a [[space helmet]]. Named in official "figurines":[https://www.myplasticheart.com/vivi-by-vivinos-pre-order-ships-jun-2022].

title: flower_underskirt
body:
Use this tag when flowers are put underneath a [[skirt]] or the hem of a [[dress]].

This often gives the impression that the character is wearing a [[petticoat]] shaped like or made up of flowers.

title: white_night_chant_(miracle_nikki)
body: A lifetime outfit from [[Miracle Nikki]] that can be customized from [[Minstrel of Time (Miracle Nikki)|Minstrel of Time]], previously known as Bright Night. It tells the story of a girl named Rachel struggling to cope with her sister Elaine abandoning her. h4. Appearance * !post #9850235

title: minstrel_of_time_(miracle_nikki)
body:
A lifetime outfit from [[Miracle Nikki]]. It tells the story of Elaine, the best healer in Pigeon Kingdom, when she left to join the Kindred in Shadow City, leaving her sister Rachel behind.

It can be customized into [[White Night Chant (Miracle Nikki)|White Night Chant]].

title: idia_shroud
body:
Idia Shroud is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the head of Ignihyde, as well as [[Ortho Shroud|Ortho]]'s "older brother." He is shy and has a dark nature, not wanting to interact with people and staying in his dorm. He usually uses a [[tablet pc]] to communicate with other people, often carried around by Ortho. He is online gaming friends with [[Lilia Vanrouge|Muscle Red]], though neither knows the other's true identity. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Gate to Underworld[/b], allows him to open and close the door to the "underworld" (a containment center full of [[Overblot|blot phantoms]]) at S.T.Y.X. headquarters.[/spoiler]

He comes from the Island of Woe, and his parents are [[Mr. Shroud]] and [[Mrs. Shroud]]. He helps maintain Ortho's body and creates new "gears" for him to utilize. When excited, his [[fiery hair]] can turn from blue to red. He is a member of the Board Games Club alongside [[Azul Ashengrotto]].

[spoiler]When he was younger, he carelessly used his unique magic to open the underworld, resulting in his younger brother Ortho's death by a Phantom. In his grief, he created the robotic Ortho to try and revive him, though acknowledges as the end of Book 6 that the "soul" inside of Ortho is not the original Ortho. He tells Ortho that he no longer needs to stay by his side at that point, but Ortho decides to stay as his brother anyways and become a student at Night Raven College.[/spoiler]

He is associated with the skull 💀 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Uchiyama Kouki]]
[b]Age:[/b] 18
[b]Birthday:[/b] December 18
[b]Class:[/b] 3-B

title: azul_ashengrotto
body:
Azul Ashengrotto is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the head of the [[Octavinelle dorm]]. He manages the Mostro Lounge, a café located in the Octavinelle dormitory building. His unique magic, [b]It's a Deal[/b], allows him to steal and utilize other people's magic abilities by signing a magical contract with them.

He comes from the Coral Sea, where he grew up with [[Jade Leech]] and [[Floyd Leech]]. His true form is an [[octopus boy]], and uses magic to transform into a human. He is a member of the Board Games club alongside [[Idia Shroud]].

[spoiler]He was bullied as a kid for being [[fat]] and has always been self-conscious about his appearance ever since. He works very hard to maintain a fit body and to make sure nobody ever discovers his shameful past, resulting in him sending [[Yuu (twisted wonderland)|]] and company on a quest to steal a picture from the Coral Sea museum where a class photo from elementary school was on display.[/spoiler]

He is associated with the octopus 🐙 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Tamaru Atsushi]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17
[b]Birthday:[/b] February 24
[b]Class:[/b] 2-C Student 3

title: jack_howl
body:
Jack Howl is a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Savanaclaw dorm]]. He is a tough delinquent [[wolf boy]] who strictly adheres to hierarchy of power and strives to increase his own strengths. He dislikes associating with others. He is notably taller than most other students at Night Raven College, standing at 192cm. His unique magic, [b]Unleash Beast[/b], allows him to transform into a [[white wolf]].

He comes from the Shaftlands and was [[Vil Schoenheit]]'s neighbor and childhood friend. He is part of the Track and Field club alongside [[Deuce Spade]].

He is associated with the wolf 🐺 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Ban Taito]]

title: deuce_spade
body:
Deuce Spade is a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Heartslabyul dorm]]. He enrolled in the school aiming to become a powerful mage. He's very serious, but a little disorganized. He's roommates and rivals with [[Ace Trappola|Ace]]. His unique magic revealed in Episode 5, [spoiler][b]Bet the Limit[/b], allows him to absorb another person's magic and throw it back at them.[/spoiler] Has a penchant for summoning [[cauldron]]s.

In middle school, he was a [[delinquent]] with [[bleached hair]], though at Night Raven College he's trying to be an honor student. He comes from the Queendom of Roses and grew up with his mother, [[Dylla Spade]]. He is a member of the Track and Field Club alongside [[Jack Howl]].

He is associated with the spade ♠️ emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kobayashi Chiaki]]

title: vil_schoenheit
body:
Vil Schoenheit is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year student]] and the head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Pomefiore dorm]]. He is a gorgeous and eye-catching [[bishounen]]. He thinks he is the most beautiful and spares no effort for beauty. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Fairest One of All[/b], allows him to apply curses to objects which activate and deactivate only under specific conditions.[/spoiler]

He comes from the Shaftlands, where [[Jack Howl]] was one of his neighbors growing up. [[Erik Venue]] is his father, and he is a member of the Film Research club. [[Neige LeBlanche]] is his rival.

He is associated with the crown 👑 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Aiba Hiroki]]

title: ortho_shroud
body:
Ortho Shroud is a member of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s Ignihyde and the younger "brother" of [[Idia Shroud|Idia]]. He always works with him and has the character of his older brother. In contrast to him, he is bright, honest, and very curious. He comes from the Island of Woe, and has his [[robot]] body maintained by Idia. He can swap between different "gears" for different purposes, and his hair is designed to match his brother's.

[spoiler]When Idia was younger, he carelessly used his unique magic to open the underworld, resulting in his younger brother Ortho's death by a Phantom. In his grief, he created the robotic Ortho to try and revive him, though acknowledges as the end of Book 6 that the "soul" inside of Ortho is not the original Ortho. He tells Ortho that he no longer needs to stay by his side at that point, but Ortho decides to stay as his brother anyways.[/spoiler] At the end of Book 6, he is admitted as a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year student]] at Night Raven College, whereupon he joins the Film Research club with [[Vil Schoenheit]].

He is associated with the fire 🔥 and robot 🤖 emojis.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Aoi Shouta]]
[b]Age:[/b] ???
[b]Birthday:[/b] August 14
[b]Class:[/b] [spoiler]1-C[/spoiler]

title: lilia_vanrouge
body:
Lilia Vanrouge is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Diasomnia dorm]] and is [[Malleus Draconia|Malleus]]' supervisor. He is a mysterious person who although has the appearance of a young boy, is rumored to be an ancient being. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Far Cry Cradle[/b], allows him to view a short snippet of an object's memories.[/spoiler]

He comes from Briar Valley, and is [[Silver Vanrouge]]'s adoptive father. He is a member of the [[Pop Music Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He is associated with the bat 🦇 emoji.

title: epel_felmier
body:
Epel Felmier is a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year student]] of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Pomefiore dorm]]. He's an [[androgynous]] [[trap]] who doesn't talk much, in order to conceal his country bumpkin manner of speaking. His unique magic revealed in Episode 6, [spoiler][b]Sleep Kiss[/b], allowing him to immobilize targets inside a glass coffin.[/spoiler] Dislikes his petite body and wishes to become [[muscular]].

He comes from the country village of Harveston. [[Marja Felmier]] is his grandmother. He is a member of the [[Spelldrive Club]].

He is associated with the apple 🍎 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Tsuchiya Shinba]]

title: riddle_rosehearts
body:
Riddle Rosehearts is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the dorm head of [[Heartslabyul dorm]]. He strictly upholds strange rules made by the Queen of Hearts. He's feared by the rest of the students because of his severe punishments toward those who break the rules. His unique magic, [b]Off with Your Head![/b], places a heart-shaped collar around someone's neck, causing their own magic to be sealed away until he removes it. It has no effect on non-magic users besides being an inconvenience.

He comes from the Queendom of Roses, where he grew up alongside [[Trey Clover]] and [[Che'nya]]. He is a member of the [[Equestrian club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He is associated with the rose 🌹 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hanae Natsuki]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17
[b]Birthday:[/b] August 24
[b]Class:[/b] 2-E Student 26

h4. Appearance
* !asset #31251543: [[Heartslabyul dorm uniform]]

title: truth_(fma)
body:
[quote][i]I am what you call The World
or the Universe, or God, or Truth
or All, or One
and, I am "You"[/i][/quote]

A being in [[Fullmetal Alchemist]] who resides at [[the gate (fma)|the Gate of Truth]] and is analogous to God. It has the form of a featureless [[silhouette]] with a [[grin]] that takes on the same size, body build, and voice of whoever meets it.

title: gluttony_(fma)
body:
A character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]. He is one of the homunculus based on the seven deadly sins.

He is a short, fat man with bald head, [[solid circle eyes]], and a big nose. He wears a black [[sleeveless bodysuit]] and [[wristband]]s. He has a large tongue with the homunculus tattoo printed onto it.

He has a childish demeanor and an extreme fondness for [[Lust (fma)|]].

title: bloomers
body:
A type of [[underwear]] constructed much like boxer shorts worn by women. Most bloomers, unlike boxers, are gathered at the bottom of the legs. Often bloomers will be decorated with ribbon or [[frills]] at the waist and legs. In Japanese they are sometimes translated as [i]kabopan[/i] or "pumpkin pants".

Not to be confused with [[buruma]], an English to Japanese to English translation of bloomer, usually identifying an over-panty, or a public garment whose purpose is to cover the panty and crotch area while leaving the maximum maneuvering room.

While bloomers originally served as underwear, they are not necessarily considered underwear now. Traditional bloomers can go all the way to the knees or shins, and don't resemble typical underwear in the present day. Shorter bloomers can be worn as regular shorts or safety shorts. These shouldn't be tagged as [[underwear]] nor [[pantyshot]]. Note that this doesn't mean they can't be sensitive, rating:S and tags like [[upskirt]] still apply.

title: envy_(fma)
body:
One of the antagonists in [[Fullmetal Alchemist]].

They are a homunculus with an [[androgynous]] voice and appearance and the ability to shapeshift into other people. In their normal form, they appear to be a [[toned]] man with [[long hair]] (very dark green, but for tagging purposes usually [[black hair|black]] in most posts). They wear a black [[crop top]], [[skorts]], [[fingerless gloves]], and [[stirrup legwear]].

[spoiler]In their true form, they become a huge, reptilian monster with [[green skin]], [[extra legs]], [[extra pupils]] in [[heterochromia|one eye]], and the heads of all the souls in their [[philosopher's stone]] emerging from their side.

[spoiler]In their actual true form, they are a small worm-like creature with large eyes, extra legs, and a [[lamprey]]-like mouth.[/spoiler][/spoiler]

title: greed_(fma)
body:
A character from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]]. He is one of the homunculus based on the seven deadly sins and embodies greed and avarice. He has sharp facial features, including a snaky grin and [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[black hair]].

Also nicknamed "the Ultimate Shield", he has the ability to turn his entire skin into hard, impenetrable graphene, though he mainly uses it to create sharp claws on his hands.

[spoiler]After his capture and absorption by [[Father (fma)|]], he was later put into [[Ling Yao]], who accepted and allowed Greed to possess his body. In this form Ling/Greed had Greed's facial features including his grin and eyes.[/spoiler]

title: morgan_le_fay_(fate)
body:
The [[fate (series)|Fate series]]' interpretation of Morgan le Fay, [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|Artoria]]'s sister and [[Mordred (fate)|]]'s mother. Morgan appears very similar to Artoria, but wears a black crown with a black veil, and a black dress.

She is introduced as a playable Berserker-class Servant in the 6th Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]], Fairy Realm of the Round Table: [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]], [spoiler]where she serves as the Lostbelt Queen[/spoiler].

body:

title: van_gogh_(fate)
body:
Foreigner-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]], introduced during the [[Imaginary Scramble]] event. She is a [[genderswap (mtf)|]]ped version of [[Vincent Van Gogh (person)|]], a Dutch post-impressionist painter who is among the most famous and influential figures in the history of Western art, though he was considered a failure and a madman during his lifetime. His most famous paintings include [i]The Starry Night[/i], [i]Cafe Terrace at Night[/i], and the [i]Sunflowers[/i] series.

[spoiler]It is revealed later that the named servant is not in anyway related to Van Gogh but instead is "Clytie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clytie_(Oceanid), a water nymph and daughter of Oceanus and Tethys from Greek Mythology, and her existence is more in line with the [[passionlip (fate)|Alter]] [[meltryllis (fate)|Egos]] where they are [[kingprotea (fate)|goddesses]] and [[sitonai (fate)|deities]] forced into a mixed existence of human form. 

[[Vincent Van Gogh (person)|]] in [[Fate (series)|]] has the ability to transform Servants into Gods through his artwork, thus he was targeted by the Outer Gods who desired him for their plans. However, rather than submitting to their wills, he killed himself in an act of defiance that carried over with him even as a Heroic Spirit. This forced the Outer Gods to instead create another "Van Gogh" using his powers and memories and mixing his "Spirit Origin/Saint Graph":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Saint_Graph with that of Clytie's, creating a cruel combination of Clytie (her body), "Vincent" (his abilities) and with power of that of an "Outer God/Foreigners'":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Foreigner.

Their existence as a Servant thus becomes an endless struggle of conflicting existence, where Vincent will constantly try to kill himself by various curses (as seen from their first ability; Void Space Fine Arts), and Clytie, who is determined to stay alive, will defy his attempts (reviving herself with the "Guts" skill).[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Kibadori Rue]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Takahashi Karin]]

title: tutankhamun_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Mystery House Crafters]] event. One of the most famous Pharaohs of Ancient Egypt, Tutankhamun acceded to the throne at 9 years of age. During his reign he undid the shift of Ancient Egyptian religion caused by Akhenaten, who is believed to have been Tutankhamun's father. Tutankhamun's reign ended when died around age 18. Tutankhamun was made famous in modern times by the discovery of his tomb in 1922. Compared to a lot of other pharaohs, Tutankhamun's tomb was largely undisturbed, and a lot of its contents, including treasures and his undisturbed mummy, were left intact. This discovery led to a renewed interest in Ancient Egypt by the public. The deaths of various individuals who were involved in the excavation of his tomb led to popular rumors regarding the "curse of the pharaoh". His third ascension is locked until players complete [[Mystery House Crafters]]. [b]Character Design:[/b] [[YOCO_N (lasengle)|]] [b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Abe Rika]] h4. title: levchenko_ahapiia_oleksandrivna
body:
Levchenko Ahapiia Oleksandrivna (more commonly known as Ahapa) is a female Ukrainian character who is a police officer, subject to the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine. Her companion is [[Victor Melnyk]].

She was designed in 2022 by [[Linyvets chan]] as the counter-response of [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|Alpha 1918]] during the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]], drawing inspiration from the German-installed Second Ukrainian Hetmanate which existed briefly after the end of World War I (which ironically cooperated with the White Army, whom Alpha 1918 also represents, during the Russian Civil War against the Bolsheviks).

h4. External links

* "Marichka Wiki (English)":https://marichka.fandom.com/wiki/Ahapa
* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%90%D0%B3%D0%B0%D0%BF%D0%B0

title: jellie_(hermitcraft)
body:
Pet cat of YouTuber [[GoodTimesWithScar]]. She exists in the real world as well as multiple fictional ones such as [[Hermitcraft]] and [[Traffic Life Series]]. She has grey and white patched fur and green eyes.

She is also the basis for one of the [[cat_(minecraft)|cat variants]] in [[Minecraft]] itself, after having won a contest for a community member's cat to be added to the game.

She passed away in January 2024 at 17 years old.

* !post #8128771: Jellie
* !post #9747606: A Minecraft cat with the Jellie texture

title: life_mushroom_(mario)
body:
A [[power-up]] from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Galaxy]] and later [[Super Mario Galaxy 2]]. They extend the player's maximum health to six and will refill the life meter when collected.

They are depicted as a red [[mushroom]] with [[star (symbol)|]]s in place of spots and [[black eyes]], appearing similar to a [[super mushroom]].

Not to be confused with the [[1-up mushroom]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31564326

h4. See also

* [[1-up mushroom]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Life Mushroom":https://www.mariowiki.com/Life_Mushroom

title: 3-up_moon
body:
A [[power-up]] from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario World]]. They reappeared in [[New Super Mario Bros. U]] and [[New Super Luigi U]], where they can be found inside [[block (mario)|]]s exclusively in Boost Mode. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe]], with the removal of Boost Mode, they instead appear in blocks replacing [[1-up mushroom]]s when playing with [[Toadette]]. They are extremely rare and give the player three extra lives when collected.

They are depicted as a yellow [[crescent moon]] with black eyes and a [[smiley face]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31564141

h4. See also

* [[1up]]
* [[1-up mushroom]]

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: 3-Up Moon":https://www.mariowiki.com/3-Up_Moon

title: mahou_shoujo_ikusei_keikaku_restart
body:
Magical Girl Raising Project: Restart is the second story arc of [[Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku|Magical Girl Raising Project]].

h4. Summary

The deadly game is back!

Once again, sixteen Magical Girls have been assembled for a high-stakes challenge. Every three days, their Magical Phone pull them into an RPG-like simulation where they have to work together to fight enemies, solve puzzles, and earn Magical Candy to advance. A staggering ten billion yen reward awaits them at the end - but only for the players who lands the finishing blow. With such a tantalizing prize on the line, it's only a matter of time before the girls turn on each other - and if their hit points drop to zero, a game over will be the least of their worries...

title: mahou_shoujo_ikusei_keikaku
body:
[b]Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku[/b] (魔法少女育成計画, lit. [i]Magical Girl Raising Project[/i], abbrev. [i]Mahoiku[/i]) is a magical girl action survival light novel series by Endou Asari. An anime adaptation by Lerche began airing Fall 2016 (Q4), covering the first arc "Unmarked."

When a picture only depicts a character's human form, please also tag their magical girl name as an umbrella tag for that character. When a picture only depicts a recurring protagonist, there is no need to tag the specific arc.

Please note that there are two identical mascots in the series: Fav and Fal. Fav only appeared in Unmarked, while Fal is a recurring character since Restart.

title: rca_connector
body:
A connector commonly used for audio and video signals, sometimes called Cinch connector. Comes in various colors.

Plugs have a single prong in the middle and a metallic ring around it, which may be fully visible or mostly covered in the plug’s plastic housing. Jacks are metallic all around and have colored plastic with a hole in the middle. They are commonly used for tape and CD players, game consoles, VHS recorders and DVD players from before the digital HD video era. Signals are always analog, except for S/PDIF digital audio, which uses only a single connector.

Connectors usually come in differently colored sets of two, three or five. White and red (sometimes black and red) for left and right channel stereo audio; yellow, white and red for composite video and stereo audio; red, green and blue for RGB or YPbPr component video with no audio; or red, green and blue, white and another red for component video and stereo audio.

h4. Examples

* post #2354973 - yellow and white for composite video and mono audio
* post #2599908 (top right) - yellow, white and red for composite video and stereo audio
* post #3546259 - white and red for stereo audio

h4. See also

* [[audio jack]] for headphones and microphones

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: RCA connector":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RCA_connector]

title: ullrid_(girls'_frontline_2)
body:
An android in [[Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium]]. She wields a [[sword]] as her primary weapon and a [[bow (weapon)|]] as a secondary weapon. Voiced by [[Saito Yuka]].

The leader of the Doll Community, an independent self-governing group of dolls surviving in the irradiated Yellow Zone, Ullrid is very close to [[Littara (girls' frontline 2)|]], who she treats as a close confidant, and [[Suomi (girls' frontline 2)|]], who she treats as a younger sister. While she typically comes off as a calm and collected older sister, those close to her are aware of her self-doubts and deep underlying frustrations with herself. To deal with stress, Ullrid heavily uses stress relief toys. Due to her past experiences, she isn't particularly trusting of humans.

Her name is a combination of Ullr and rid, the former the Norse god associated with skiing, and the latter due to wanting "to get rid of herself from the hunting grounds", alluding her past.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7697053

h4. See also

* [[list_of_girls'_frontline_characters#Exilium|List of Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium characters]]

h4. External links

* "IOP Wiki: Ullrid":[https://iopwiki.com/wiki/Ullrid]

title: rena_(blue_archive)
body:
An unplayable character from [[Blue Archive]]. She is a student of Wild Hunt Academy and a member of Occult Studies Club.

Her full name is [b]Kinui Rena[/b].

Rena has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[blonde streaks|blonde]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] tied into [[twintails]] with [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon]]s, [[sidelocks]], [[purple eyes]], [[yellow nails]] and a [[yellow halo]]. She wears a [[yellow cardigan]] with [[puffy long sleeves|puffy long]] [[cross-laced sleeves]] overtop a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] (a [[white leg warmers|white leg warmer]] on her right leg and a [[white socks|white sock]] on her left) and a pair of [[black shoes]]. She also has [[multiple hair bows]], [[hairclip]]s and often carries a small [[yellow bag]].

title: malleus_draconia
body:
Malleus Draconia is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the dorm leader of [[Diasomnia dorm|Diasomnia]]. He is a descendant of the fairies, and his magic power is amongst one of the strongest in the world. He has a distinguished presence at Night Raven College, but his powerful aura causes the other students to keep their distance. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Fae of Maleficence[/b], allows him to envelop an area in a barrier of thorns and induce a dreaming slumber for all beings inside it. He has complete control over anything inside the magical field and can observe the dreams of all affected by it.[/spoiler]

He comes from Briar Valley and was raised by [[Lilia Vanrouge]] since he was little. [[Maleanor Draconia]] and [[Raverne Draconia]] are his parents. He's nicknamed Tsunotarou or Hornton by [[Yuu (twisted Wonderland)|]] and is the sole member of the Gargoyle Studies Club.

He is associated with the dragon 🐉 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kato Kazuki]]
[b]Age:[/b] [spoiler]178[/spoiler]
[b]Birthday:[/b] January 18
[b]Class:[/b] 3-D Student 6

title: leona_kingscholar
body:
Leona Kingscholar is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year]] [[lion boy]], and the leader of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Savanaclaw dorm]]. While he has great magic powers, he doesn't like using much effort, and constantly appears lax and leisurely. He's the second prince of his home country and acts arrogantly toward everyone. He's been held back twice, making him two years older than the other third-years at Night Raven College. His unique magic, [b]King's Roar[/b], allows him to transform anything he touches into sand.

He comes from the Sunset Savanna, where he grew up as the second prince of the Kingscholar royal family. [[Falena Kingscholar]] is his older brother, and [[Cheka Kingscholar]] is his nephew. He is a member of the [[Spelldrive Club]].

He is associated with the lion 🦁 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Umehara Yuuichirou]]
[b]Age:[/b] 20
[b]Birthday:[/b] July 27
[b]Class:[/b] 3-A Student 13

title: king_kamehameha_(umamusume)
body:
Unimplemented [[Umamusume]] character based on [[King Kamehameha (racehorse)|]].

She made a brief appearence in the [[2016 umamusume promotional video|2016 promotional video]], where she's seen hitting on [[Hishi Amazon (umamusume)|]] and latching on her afterwards. This characterization is allegedly why Makoto Kaneko, the owner of the real King Kamehameha as well as [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]] and [i]many[/i] potential prospects refused to get involved with [[Umamusume]].

So far, two of his progenies have made appearances in [i]Umamusume[/i]: 
* [[Hokko Tarumae (umamusume)|]] (2014 Champions Cup, Tokyo Daishoten (2013, 2014), Kawasaki Kinen (2014-16)
* [[Duramente (umamusume)|]] (2015 Satsuki Sho, 2015 Tokyo Yushun).

In addition:
* [[Almond Eye (umamusume)|]] (2018 Triple Tiara, Japan Cup (2018, 2020)) - Granddaughter.
* [[Admire Groove (Umamusume)]] (Queen Elizabeth II Cup (2003, 2004), 2005 Hanshin Himba Stakes) - One of his mates.
other_names: キングカメハメハ(ウマ娘)

title: polyester_(psg)
body:
A male [[angel]] character who debuts in the sixth episode of the second season of [i][[Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt]][/i] (also known as [i]New PSG[/i]), alongside his younger brother, [[Polyurethane (psg)]], and is a cousin of the [[Panty (psg)|Anarchy]] [[Stocking (psg)|Sisters]].

He is depicted with [[red eyes]], a [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[purple hair|purple]]-[[blue hair|blue]] [[bowl cut]] [[hair over eyes|covering an eye]], a [[black choker]], a [[sleeveless]] [[v-neck]] [[white bodysuit|white spandex suit]] with a visible [[bulge]], a pair of [[white gloves]], and a [[charm|black charm]] which resembles the "heaven" kanji (天).

Thinks very highly of himself, most likely as a direct result of the advanced technology that he uses. Prone to be in fits when his plans go awry, which can cause his behavior to be spontaneous.

title: polyurethane_(psg)
body:
A male [[angel]] character who debuts in the sixth episode of the second season of [i][[Panty & Stocking with Garterbelt]][/i] (also known as [i]New PSG[/i]), alongside his older brother, [[Polyester (Psg)]], and is a cousin of the [[Panty (psg)|Anarchy]] [[Stocking (psg)|Sisters]].

He is depicted with [[blue eyes]], [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[purple hair|purple]]-[[pink hair|pink]] hair with [[blunt bangs]], [[black earrings]], [[black nails]], a [[black choker]], a [[sleeveless]] [[v-neck]] [[black bodysuit|black spandex suit]] with a visible [[bulge]] and a [[thigh cutout]], and a [[white belt|white]] cloth belt around his waist.

Similar to his older brother, he has a similarly-inflated ego (which, again, is mostly due to his privileged access to new-age tech) and gets impetuous when situations are left out of his and Polyester's control.

title: panty_&_stocking_with_garterbelt
body:
An action-comedy anime series produced by [[Gainax]], airing from October 2, 2010 to December 25, 2010. Notable for its Western art style.

It's the story about two [[angel]]s thrown out of [[Heaven]] who now occupy a city located somewhere between heaven and [[Hell]] where strange monsters called "[[Ghost (psg)|]]s" start terrorizing the place. By destroying these Ghosts they receive Heaven Coins which will allow them back into heaven.

A second season began airing on July 10, 2025, this time produced by [[Trigger (company)|]], made up of former Gainax staff that produced the first season.

title: georgia_(country)
body:
[b]Georgia[/b] is a country in the Caucasus region on the coast of the Black Sea, also known as [b]Sakartvelo[/b]. It regained independence in 1991 with the collapse of the [[Soviet Union]].

title: camouflage
body:
Camouflage is protective coloration or pattern meant to disguise animals, people, or military equipment through deception and reducing visibility against a particular environment, backdrop or terrain. 

Camouflage patterns are generally used in [[military uniform]]s and often associated with the [[military]].

title: borjgali
body:
Borjgali is a Georgian symbol of the Sun and eternity.

 The Borjgali is often represented with seven rotating wings over the tree of life which can be used to create various shapes and variations. It is considered one of the main symbols of Georgian culture.

Today, it is used on contemporary Georgian airlines, currency, athlete teams.

title: nested_mouths
body:
A mouth that contains a smaller mouth or set of jaws inside it. Can be used for multiple "layers" of mouths inside mouths (such as an [[eldritch abomination]] might have, but does not apply to masks with mouth or jaw designs.

Commonly found in the [[xenomorph|eponymous aliens]] and [[Alien Queen]] of the [[alien (1979)|Alien franchise]].

title: tsugaruben
body:
A Japanese dialect spoken in the western parts of Aomori Prefecture. Technically belongs to the [[Tohokuben]] dialect family, but diverges significantly in some places to the point of being considered a separate dialect by some Japanese people.

Infamous for being considered [i]the[/i] hardest-to-understand dialect in Japan. Even people within [i]the same prefecture[/i] (never mind the rest of the Tohoku region, or the rest of Japan) have problems understanding speakers of this dialect.

October 23 is considered to be Tsugaru Dialect Day, so occasionally people will write and perform skits and performances employing the Tsugaru dialect on that day. Japanese (fan)artists may also follow suit.

There are also various local competitions and events that feature the Tsugaru dialect. These are sometimes broadcasted on Japanese national television.   

h4. Notable characters who speak Tsugaru dialect

* Several [[Flying Witch]] characters
* [[Hannah (Mahjong Soul)]]

title: kim_kardashian
body:
[b]Kimberly Noel Kardashian[/b](born October 21, 1980) or [b]Kim Kardashian[/b] is Armenian-American model, media personality, socialite, and businesswoman known for her hit reality show with her family, [b]Keeping Up with the Kardashians[/b], which aired from 2007 to 2021.

Prior to her reality show fame, she was known during the early 1990s as the daughter of lawyer and businessman Robert Kardashian(February 22, 1944 – September 30, 2003), who was one of lawyers defending his friend, OJ Simpson, after he was arrested and accused of murdering his ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ronald Goldman in 1994 before Simpson was acquitted of the charges in 1995. Her fame started when she worked as a stylist for her celebrity friends which included [[Paris Hilton]] and Nicole Richie during the run of their hit reality show, [b]The Simple Life[/b]. Thanks to her connection with Paris (and an infamous sex tape of Kim and singer Ray J) that got her and family their own reality show with E! Entertainment Television. 

She is also the ex-wife of [[Kanye West]], having married him 2014 and four children with him before divorcing in 2022.
other_names: キンバリー・カーダシアン

title: izayoi_sakuya
body:
The "Perfect and Elegant Maid". Stage 5 boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and later the third most recurring playable character (being playable in six official games) after protagonists [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]].

Head [[maid]] of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and personal attendant to its mistress [[Remilia Scarlet]] despite being the only human in the household. Sakuya possesses mastery of [[throwing knife|throwing knives]], as well as the ability to slow and stop time, making her somewhat a homage to [[Dio Brando]] of [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]]. She is zealously loyal to Remilia, and is frequently depicted in doujin berating the gatekeeper, [[Hong Meiling]], though their relationship in canon is generally much friendlier. Due to her [[Immaterial and Missing Power]] portrait depicting her with considerably larger breasts than her usual portraits, jokes abound of her using [[breast padding]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3276500: Profile
She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair]] with [[twin braids]] tied with [[green bow|green]] [[hair bow|bows]]. Her eye color varies somewhat but is usually [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[red eyes|red]]. She wears a [[maid headdress]], a [[black bowtie]], either a [[skirt set|matching]] [[blue vest]] and [[blue skirt|blue]] or a [[blue dress|blue]] [[pinafore dress]] over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron]], [[white socks]], and either [[black shoes]] or [[brown boots]]. 

h4. Related Pools

* Pool #5086:  Touhou - Sakuya's Pads
* Pool #21411:  Touhou - Sakuya's Elegant Knives

h4. See also

* [[breast padding]]
* [[knifed]]
* [[Tsurikichi Obasan]]
* [[Inu Sakuya (nejikirio)|]]: a dog-like caricature of Sakuya, from [[Nejikirio]]'s work.

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Sakuya Izayoi":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Sakuya_Izayoi

title: hong_meiling
body:
Stage 3 mid-boss and boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]], and later a recurring playable character.

A humanoid youkai (presumably resembling a Han Chinese). She works as the gatekeeper of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] and specializes in Chinese martial arts. Unusually for a Touhou character, it is unclear what kind of youkai Meiling is, but many fans associate her with [[dragon]]s due to the [[star hat ornament|star]] on her [[green hat|green]] [[beret]], which bears the Chinese character for "dragon" (龍, [i]Long[/i]). Hong is also the name of a specific dragon from Chinese mythology, implying Meiling has some relation or actually is Hong, leading to frequent depictions [[Hong Meiling (dragon)|as a dragon]]. There are also occasional images that depict her [[Hong Meiling (panda)|as a panda]].

Fandom also often depicts Meiling as being lazy and ineffective at her job, and often being berated and/or [[knifed|punished]] for this by [[Izayoi Sakuya]]. In canon, however, her relationship with Sakuya is actually something closer to amicable co-workers, if not outright friendship, and she is generally very good at her job of repelling intruders, with the notable exception of [[Kirisame Marisa]], who everyone else at the mansion admits is impossible to keep out when she wants access to [[Voile]].

Sometimes known by her nickname "China" (中国, [i]Chuugoku[/i]), which originated on [[2channel]] during a debate about the proper reading of her name's kanji (some believed it to be the Japanese reading "Kurenai Misuzu", and it wasn't until later that [[ZUN]] revealed that the Chinese reading "Hong Meiling" is correct). Fans came to an agreement that her defining characteristic is being Chinese, and thus called her "China".

h4. Appearance

* !post #6475466: Profile
She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair|orange]] or [[red hair]] with [[twin braids]] tied in [[green bow|green]] or [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bows]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], a [[green vest]] over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]] with [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[skirt set|matching]] [[green skirt]] [[pants under skirt|over]] [[white pants]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[flats]]. Some fanart has her wearing something closer to a [[tangzhuang]] or [[china dress]].

h4. See also 

* [[Hong Meiling (dragon)]]
* [[Hong Meiling (panda)]]
* [[Hei Meiling]] 
* [[Lie Meiling]] 
* [[knifed]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hong Meiling":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hong_Meiling

title: rook_hunt
body:
Rook Hunt is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year]] and the vice head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Pomefiore dorm]]. He loves beautiful things, and appreciates [[Vil Schoenheit|Vil]] and [[Epel Felmier|Epel]]'s beauty. He's an elusive individual. Uses gratuitous French in his dialogue. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]I See You[/b], allows him to track any target regardless of distance.[/spoiler]

He comes from the Sunset Savanna, where he was a [[stalking|fervent fan]] of [[Leona Kingscholar]]. [spoiler]He was originally admitted into the Savanaclaw Dorm, but later transferred to Pomefiore out of admiration for Vil.[/spoiler] He is a member of the Science Club alongside [[Trey Clover]].

He is associated with the bow and arrow 🏹 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Itokawa Youjirou]]

title: silver_vanrouge
body:
Silver Vanrouge (initially introduced as simply Silver) is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Diasomnia dorm]] who guards [[Malleus Draconia|Malleus]] like a knight. Though normally taciturn and composed, he occasionally appears to be very drowsy. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Meet in a Dream[/b], allows him to enter other people's dreams.[/spoiler]

He comes from Briar Valley and is the foster son of [[Lilia Vanrouge]]. [spoiler]His biological father is the [[Knight of the Dawn (twisted wonderland)|]]. Prior to being blessed by Lilia as a baby, he had [[blonde hair]].[/spoiler] He is a member of the [[Equestrian Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He is associated with the swords ⚔️ emoji.

title: jade_leech
body:
Jade Leech is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]], the vice head of [[Octavinelle dorm]], and [[Azul Ashengrotto|Azul]]'s assistant as well as [[Floyd Leech|Floyd]]'s twin. His unique magic, [b]Shock the Heart[/b], allows him to compel someone to speak the truth in response to a single question, however it doesn't always work against strong magicians or overly cautious people.

Although he and Floyd look very similar, Jade is noted as having "neater" clothing than his twin. His bowtie is done, his shirt is buttoned up, and his suit isn't very wrinkled. He his has [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[yellow eyes|yellow eye]] and his black hair streak on his left side.

Both Leech twins are [[eel boy]]s from the Coral Sea that use magic to transform into humans. Their mother is [[Georgina Leech]]. He is the sole member of the Mountain Lovers' Club, which he uses as a justification to go foraging for [[mushroom]]s.

He is associated with the dolphin 🐬 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Komada Wataru]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17
[b]Birthday:[/b] November 5
[b]Class:[/b] 2-E Student 13

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31254859: [[Night Raven College school uniform]]

title: floyd_leech
body:
Floyd Leech is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Octavinelle dorm]]. He's [[Jade Leech|Jade]]'s twin but their attitude and speech are totally different. He's kind of unpredictable so it's difficult to know what he's thinking. His unique magic, [b]Bind the Heart[/b], allows him to block an opponent's attacks so they always miss.

Although he and Jade look very similar, Floyd is noted as having "messier" clothing than his twin. His bowtie is undone, his shirt is unbuttoned, and his suit is more wrinkled. He his has [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[yellow eyes|yellow eye]] and his black hair streak on his right side.

Both Leech twins are [[eel boy]]s from the Coral Sea that use magic to transform into humans. Their mother is [[Georgina Leech]]. He is a member of the [[Basketball Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He has a tendency to nickname people after various marine life, such as nicknaming [[Yuu (twisted wonderland)|]] Koebi-chan (Little [[Shrimp]]y). Gained an interest in fashion and shoes in particular after becoming human.

He is associated with the shark 🦈 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Okamoto Nobuhiko]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17
[b]Birthday:[/b] November 5
[b]Class:[/b] 2-D Student 17

title: sebek_zigvolt
body:
Sebek Zigvolt is a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Diasomnia dorm]]. He's very delighted to be able to enter Night Raven College with [[Malleus Draconia|Malleus]], whom he respects very much. He often butts heads with [[Silver Vanrouge|Silver]] over their differing opinions. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Living Bolt[/b], allows him to transform into lightning for rapid movement or combat purposes.[/spoiler]

He comes from Briar Valley, and is half-fairy on his mother's side. [[Baur Zigvolt]] is his grandfather. Known for his [[shouting|loud voice]]. He is a member of the [[Equestrian Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He is associated with the lightning bolt ⚡️ and crocodile 🐊 emojis.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Ishiya Haruki]]

title: jamil_viper
body:
Jamil Viper is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]] and the vice head of Scarabia. His ancestors have served the Al-Asim family generation after generation, so he's been dragged around by the careless [[Kalim Al-Asim|Kalim]] since they were young. His unique magic, [spoiler][b]Snake Whisper[/b], allows him to hypnotize others when they look into his eyes and control their will.[/spoiler]

He and Kalim both come from the Scalding Sands. [[Najma Viper]] is his older sister, and he is a member of the [[Basketball Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

[spoiler]Because of his family's historical relationship with the Al-Asims, he's been instructed since he was little to be Kalim's friend but also always subservient to him, always told to never outshine him. This resulted in him suppressing his own talents and building a resentment towards the oblivious Kalim, eventually resulting in him hypnotizing Kalim during Book 4 to try and ruin his reputation as dorm warden. Kalim still accompanies him after the incident, but Jamil no longer pretends to be his friend or suppress his abilities.[/spoiler]

He is associated with the snake 🐍 emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Futaba Kaname]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17
[b]Birthday:[/b] September 12
[b]Class:[/b] 2-C Student 31

title: ruggie_bucchi
body:
Ruggie Bucchi is a [[Night Raven College second years|second-year]] [[hyena boy]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Savanaclaw dorm]]. He assists [[Leona Kingscholar|Leona]] as his junior, but does not officially have the vice-housewarden title. Due to having grown up in a poor environment, he's a bit of a glutton, and especially likes [[donut]]s. His unique magic, [b]Laugh With Me[/b], allows him to control others by having them match his movements.

He comes from the Sunset Savanna where he was raised by his grandmother, and is part of the [[Spelldrive Club]].

He is associated with the cheetah 🐆 and donut 🍩 emojis.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Ichikawa Aoi]]
[b]Age:[/b] 17

title: cater_diamond
body:
Cater Diamond is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Heartslabyul dorm]]. He's very perceptive with great communication skills, as well as popular, stylish, and a gourmet. Loves posting on social media and nicknames himself Cay-kun or Cay-Cay. His unique magic, [b]Split Card[/b], allows him to create [[clone]]s of himself. He was [[Trey Clover]]'s roommate for their first two years at Night Raven College.

He comes from the Shaftlands, and is a member of the [[Pop Music Club (twisted wonderland)|]]. He is associated with the diamond ♦️ emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Kobayashi Tatsuyuki]]

title: trey_clover
body:
Trey Clover is a [[Night Raven College third years|third-year]] and the vice head of [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Heartslabyul dorm]]. He's calm and is seen as a protector by the rest. As the vice-headwarden, he always backs up the overly-strict [[Riddle Rosehearts|Riddle]]. His unique magic, [b]Doodle Suit[/b], allows him to overwrite things with what one imagines. He was [[Cater Diamond]]'s roommate for their first two years at Night Raven College.

He comes from the Queendom of Roses, where he grew up alongside [[Riddle Rosehearts]] and [[Che'nya]]. He comes from a family of dentists, making him strict on dental hygiene. He is a member of the Science Club alongside [[Rook Hunt]].

He is associated with the club ♣️ emoji.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Suzuki Ryouta]]
[b]Age:[/b] 18
[b]Birthday:[/b] October 25

title: ace_trappola
body:
Ace Trappola is a [[Night Raven College first years|first-year student]] in [[Twisted Wonderland]]'s [[Heartslabyul dorm]]. He's clever and has a bright personality, but can be a little mean too. He's roommates and rivals with [[Deuce Spade|Deuce]]. His unique magic is revealed in Episode 7, [spoiler][b]Joker Scratch[/b], with its effects currently being undetermined.[/spoiler]

He comes from the Queendom of Roses, and is a member of the [[Basketball Club (twisted wonderland)|]].

He is associated with the heart ❤️ emoji.

title: grim_(twisted_wonderland)
body:
Grim is a magic-wielding monster who serves as [[Yuu (twisted wonderland)|]]'s partner in [[Twisted Wonderland]], with the two being permitted by [[Dire Crowley]] to be enrolled as one student. He has a big mouth and easily gets carried away. Often compared to a [[tanuki]] ([[raccoon]] in the English version) by the other characters in the game.

He is associated with the paw print 🐾 and cat 😺 emojis.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Sugiyama Noriaki]]
[b]Age:[/b] ???
[b]Birthday:[/b] ???
[b]Class:[/b] 1-A Student 9

Japanese race [[horse]] named after the sword from [[The Song of Roland]]. He is most famous for giving [[ikezoe ken'ichi|ikze]] his first Grade I race victory in his career. As such, [[Umamusume]] fan-artists occasionally draw an [[original]]-design horse girl featuring an umamusu-fied version of Durandal together with other horse girls ikze rode on.

Not to be confused with the [[durandal_(usa)_(racehorse)|American racehorse]] or the [[durandal_(gb)_(racehorse)|British racehorse]].

title: recruiters_(disney)
body:
Subordinates of famous [[Disney]] villains that first appeared at [[Disneyland|Tokyo Disneysea]]'s "Villains" event during the 2015 Halloween season. They are in charge of luring park goers to join their boss's side.

h4. Characters 

h6. Hosts

* [[Ms. Vila]]

h6. Recruiters

title: florence_nightingale_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] featured in the [[E Pluribus Unum (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. The eponymous "Angel of Crimea", a British nurse from the Victorian era best known for her contribution to the modern medical study and effort to improve the conditions in hospitals.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] light [[pink hair]] worn in a [[braided ponytail]]. She wears a red [[military uniform]] with a [[black skirt]]. In her third Ascension level, she has a [[bandage over one eye]] and a [[black coat]] worn [[coat on shoulders|over her shoulders]].

Nightingale usually behaves in a cold and stoic manner. Due to the side effect of Madness Enchantment from her classification, she has an obsession with keeping anything clean or sanitized, and also causing her will to treat someone to go overboard, to the point that she will do anything to treat her patient, such as killing anyone who interrupts her treatment process.

She uses a [[pepperbox revolver]] in combat in addition to other unconventional weapons, such as throwing [[bed]]s.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takahashi Keitarou]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sawashiro Miyuki]]

[tr]

[td][[Yankee Rose (aus) (racehorse)|Yankee Rose]][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Damsire:[/td]
[td][[All American (racehorse)|]][/td]
[/tr]
[/body]
[/table]

Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Duramente (racehorse)|]] and foaled by [[Yankee Rose (aus) (racehorse)|Yankee Rose]].

This filly is famous for outright dominating the 2023 Triple Tiara by winning all three races and becoming the seventh Japanese Triple Tiara, the third in five years, following [[Almond Eye (racehorse)|]] in 2018 and [[Daring Tact (racehorse)|]] in 2020. Unfortunately, victory became elusive afterwards and any chance she would have broken out of her slump was rendered moot when she fell at the 2025 Queen Elizabeth II Cup in Hong Kong and needed to be euthanized.

She was a bay filly with a star and thin broken stripe marking. She can be easily distinguished by her mane fringe braid, decorated with a pompom of some sort.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], Liberty Island is often drawn together with other Triple Tiara winners as well as her RL sire [[Duramente (umamusume)|]], with her racing outfit often making references to the Statue of Liberty or those of her sire.

With the same owner (kind of a given in this case), trainer and [[Kitamura Yuuichi (Jockey)|main jockey]] as his mother, he won his debut race, a 1800m turf race in Kokura, the same specifications as his mother's debut race (but in late July, not early September).

title: world_of_warships
body:
Known as "World of Battleships" in 2010-2012, it changed its name to World Of Warships in later 2014 and released in September 2015 (Alongside with the Beta Test.)

A multiplayer naval combat game developed by Wargaming. Featuring [[World War I]] ironclads, [[World War II]] ships and Fictional/Prototype ships that were never been made into steel or design only. This game also features Superships, these ships are created or designed during 1945 with advanced technology, surpassing warships from the second world war.

Notably, it's collaborated with [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]], [[High School Fleet]], [[Azur Lane]] and [[Blue Archive]]. Azur Lane in particular further partners with WoWs to receive inspiration for its annual Priority Research ship series. Blue Archive in particular is the newest addition, with more students and ships coming in the future.

World Of Warships have certain modes available: 
1. Coop Battles: Regular PVE Basis.
2. Random Battles: Regular PVP Basis.
3. Operations: Wider PVE scale, with Main and Secondary Objectives to clear and succeed, has higher rewards than Coop Battles.
4. Ranked Battles: Win Battles against other players in a reduced player count and Earn stars to reach a certain league.
5. Asymmetric Battles: PVE mode with a twist: 5 Players play Higher Tiers against 12 AI Enemies which are lower on tier


h4. Ships unique to World of Warships
[tn]Sorted by appearance order[/tn]
* [[Amagi (World of Warships)|]] (0.1.5)
* [[Myogi (World of Warships)|]] (0.2.1)
* [[Moskva (World of Warships)|]] (0.5.3.2) 
* [[Henri IV (World of Warships)|]] (0.6.3)
* [[Siegfried (World of Warships)|]] (0.8.5, 2019)
* [[Thunderer (World of Warships)|]] (0.8.5, 2019)
* [[Christoforo Colombo (World of Warships)|]] (0.9.10, 2020)
* [[Schlieffen (World of Warships)|]] (0.10.7, 2021)
* [[Dalian (World of Warships)|]] (0.10.10, 2021)
* [[Yamagiri (World of Warships)|]] (0.10.10, 2021)
* [[Mecklenburg (World of Warships)|]] (0.11.2, 2022)
* [[Sun Yat-sen (World of Warships)|]] (0.11.10, 2023)
* [[Brisbane (World of Warships)|]] (0.11.11, 2023)
* [[Prins van Oranje (World of Warships)|]] (2024)

h4. See also

* [[World of Tanks]]
* [[War Thunder]]
